recommendations.recommendation:
If you liked season 1, you simply must watch this season 2. Wraps things up rather nicely while leaving you wanting more.
If you haven`t seen season 1, start there. Though I still maintain it`s not for everyone due to it`s unique pitch (pun intended).
I might be getting old, but this anime is just amazing. Realistic, funny and educational.

anime.description: * Based on a baseball seinen manga series written by http://anidb.net/cr49297 [Moritaka Yuuji] and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr49298 [Adachi Keiji]. September, after four months away due to an injury, http://anidb.net/ch94257 [Bonda Natsunosuke] is back in the majors. There are twenty-three games left in the season and three Central League teams are in a dead heat for the pennant. In the first place, the Osaka Tempters, in second, the Bunkyo Mops and the Jingu Spiders, with one game out, in third. Natsunosuke plans to contribute to the win in this deadlock situation and win brownie points with the management. "There`s money buried in the grounds."

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

episode.title: 一軍復帰
Back in the Majors
Ichigun Fukki
episode.summary: An injury just before interleague play took Bonda out of commission. Now he`s back in the majors after four months... just in time for a dead heat three-way race for the pennant! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 甘チャン
The Softy
Ama-chan
episode.summary: When Bonda came up from the minors, he an outfielder named Itsuki Roppa came with him. Itsuki hits hard and has a pregnant wife he`s playing for, but will his carefree attitude prove a liability for the team? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 首位浮上
Rising to First
Shui Fujou
episode.summary: Despite Itsuki`s amazing performance in batting practice, he just can`t deliver when it counts. His first hit comes only in a moment when it makes no difference. So after the game, Natsunosuke gives him a warning... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 祝・リーグ優勝
Celebrate! The League Pennant!
Iwai: League Yuushou
episode.summary: Despite being a major driving force in the pennant race, Itsuki Roppa has hit a wall. Then, just before a defining game against the Tempters, he receives a call that his just-born son has been sent to the ICU. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ココだけのおハナシ
Just Between Us
Koko dake no Ohanashi
episode.summary: Natsunosuke is about to do his first live broadcast, and takes a drink beforehand to give him courage. The combination of alcohol and nerves leads to him criticizing the Japan Series, sending the studio into a panic. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さびしい季節
Lonely Season
Sabishii Kisetsu
episode.summary: When Natsunosuke hears that his senpai, Korekawa, is being traded to Kobe, he decides to take him out for a farewell meal. But he chooses the restaurant where his crush Yuki works... and on TV, the Osaka Tempters are fighting for the championship crown. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦力外通告
Declared for Assignment
Senryokugai Tsuukoku
episode.summary: Can middle-aged players stand a chance in open tryouts? That`s the question that a pitcher and catcher, both talented but declared DFA due to circumstances, will bet on when they risk their careers on this open-call gamble. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファン感謝デー
Fan Appreciation Day
Fan Kansha Day
episode.summary: It`s Spiders` fan appreciation day at Jingu Stadium, and Natsunosuke and Akira go into the stands for a game of team hide-and-seek. But Natsunosuke is quickly shocked to realize that he`s chosen a seat next to Yuki! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無職で結婚...!?
Marrying While Unemployed?!
Mushoku de Kekkon...!?
episode.summary: Tokunaga`s a rising star in the commentary world, and now he`s getting engaged. But just as his future is looking bright, circumstances at his agency lead to him being released. Can Natsunosuke get through to him in time?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いきなり大逆転!
Sudden Turnaround!
Ikinari Dai Gyakuten!
episode.summary: Upon returning from his trip to Guam, Tokunaga learns that he`s been fired. Matsumoto has set up a job for him in Fukui, but will Tokunaga`s fiancee agree to join him there? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 契約更改・前編
Contract Renewals, Part One
Keiyaku Koukai: Zenpen
episode.summary: The pro baseball world is in the middle of contract renewals, and Natsunosuke`s is coming up. He visits Kitchen Ajihei to calm his nerves, but it seems his achievements are catching up with him in more ways than one! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 契約更改・後編
Contract Renewals, Part Two
Keiyaku Koukai: Kouhen
episode.summary: Natsunosuke`s quibbling over a small-but-significant addition to his contract leaves his position with the team in doubt. Will a story about a celebrity couple`s dating scandal be his saving grace? Source: crunchyroll
